quest.name: Stranger Danger
journal: Togene has a soft spot for children.

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: Have you by any chance come for a walk around the market?

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: I look after families' children while they shop here. I also keep my eyes open for any children that get separated from their parents.

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: If you happen to come across any lost boys and girls please tell them to come here.

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: If you happen to come across any lost boys and girls please tell them to come here.

dialogue.name: CHILDRENA02759
dialogue.text: You say there's a nice lady that will look after me? I will go and search for her now!

dialogue.name: CHILDRENA02759
dialogue.text: By the way, have you seen any other children that look like me?

dialogue.name: CHILDRENB02759
dialogue.text: I had no idea there was a lady like that. I will go and play with her until Daddy finishes his work!

dialogue.name: CHILDRENB02759
dialogue.text: Though I do wish I knew where my brother had gone off to. Maybe he's with the lady already.

dialogue.name: CHILDRENC02759
dialogue.text: What are you talking about? I'm not lost!

dialogue.name: CHILDRENC02759
dialogue.text: There's a lady here who looks after lost children? Maybe I'll go and speak with her... But not because I'm lost or anything!

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: I have had three children come saying you sent them to me. I was only supposed to be looking after one today, but things have gotten quite lively.

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: I never cease to be amazed by how friendly Xaela children are with each other. Tribal boundaries mean nothing to them.

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: This group alone contains a pair of Himaa twins, a Boliri girl, and the Bayaqud child that was here from the start.

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: Their tribes are all so different. One of every three Himaa pregnancies results in twins just like these two. Bayaqud women have a tradition of taking multiple husbands.

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: And the Bolir support themselves by collecting dung, drying it, and turning it into charcoal which they then sell to other tribes.

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: They have all been brought up so differently and yet they get along so well. Some days I wish we adults could behave the same.

dialogue.name: TOGENE
dialogue.text: Regardless, that is of no concern to a traveler such as yourself. Thank you for your help.
